intro: Ceratotheca elliptica, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its velvety, lance-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple blooms that are often borne on long, slender stalks. It thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. Ceratotheca elliptica is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
